contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Map.Ishibe-Town.Shiga.PNG|thumb|Ishibe in Shiga]] {{Nihongo|'''Ishibe'''|石部町|Ishibe-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Kōka District, Shiga|Kōka District]], [[Shiga Prefecture|Shiga]], [[Japan]]. There was [[Ishibe-juku]] in [[Edo period]]. On October 1, 2004 Ishibe was merged with the town of [[Kōsei, Shiga|Kōsei]], also from [[Kōka District, Shiga|Kōka District]], to form the new city of [[Konan, Shiga|Konan]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 12,418 and a [[population density|density]] of 931.58 persons per km². The total area was 13.33 km² [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Shiga Prefecture]] {{Shiga-geo-stub}}
